title: Expose `start_time()` on `trillium::Conn` to avoid needing `inner()`
body:
`trillium_http::Conn` has a `start_time()` that's useful for tracing and
similar. Expose it directly on `trillium::Conn` to avoid having to call
`conn.inner().start_time()`.

Current trillium doesn't compile with older trillium-http, because it
imports the new `HttpConfig`. This results in a compilation error if a
project ends up with new trillium without new trillium-http.

title: Bugfix: add a default limiter to received request bodies
body: additionally, partially address a bug in which polling a chunked body with a long chunk size and a short buffer never completes.

title: http bugfix: chunked body reads did not properly handle closed transports
Add fuzzing infrastructure
body:
This adds two fuzzers targeting `trillium_http::ReceivedBody`. One is particularly targeted at an infinite loop problem, across multiple polls, and the other is more generic, just looking for crashes. I added one input that triggers the infinite loop issue by choosing chunked encoding and then immediately returning an EOF after the headers.

```
.../trillium/fuzz$ cargo afl run --bin received_body_hang < in/received_body_hang/chunked_body_immediate_eof 
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.02s
     Running `target/debug/received_body_hang`
Input: FuzzInput { content_length: None, socket_reads: SocketReads { reads: [] } }
[]
did not finish reading body after 1000 polls
woke up 1000 times
```

I tried to suppress crashes due to OOM allocation failures in the infinite loop fuzzer, by providing a global allocator that exits the program with success on allocation failure. This isn't entirely effective, because some paths in the standard library perform fallible allocations, and then panic upon failure. (as opposed to the allocator itself aborting) Configuration from `afl` or `cargo-afl` turns this panic into an abort. These OOM issues ought to be addressed for DoS reasons anyway, and that will let the fuzzers progress past shallow bugs.

FWIW I am slightly regretting my choice to use AFL++ instead of libfuzzer, because I recalled late in the game that the Rust crates for the latter have [nicer support for structured fuzzing](https://fitzgeraldnick.com/2020/01/16/better-support-for-fuzzing-structured-inputs-in-rust.html), and would have let me remove dumping `Debug` representations from the fuzzing target itself.

body:
this pr:
* decreases the allocated write buffer size
* decreases the allocated header read buffer size and extends it nonlinearly when needed
* avoids writing the first line of the http response to a vec just to copy it into the buffer vec
* avoids copying each header name twice

http bugfix: address theoretical memory leak in after_send caused by std::mem::forget
body:
I have been unable to observe this actually leaking memory under any instrumentation, but the documentation for std::mem::forget indicates that it could/should leak.

As of this PR there is zero usage of std::mem::forget in trillium.

body:
Updates the requirements on [async-io](https://github.com/smol-rs/async-io) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from async-io's releases.

v2.0.0

  • Breaking: Async::new() now takes types that implement AsFd/AsSocket instead of AsRawFd/AsRawSocket, in order to implement I/O safety. (#142)
  • Breaking: Async::get_mut(), Async::read_with_mut() and Async::write_with_mut() are now unsafe. The underlying source is technically "borrowed" by the polling instance, so moving it out would be unsound. (#142)
  • Expose miscellaneous kqueue filters in the os::kqueue module. (#112)
  • Expose a way to get the underlying Poller's file descriptor on Unix. (#125)
  • Add a new Async::new_nonblocking method to allow users to avoid duplicating an already nonblocking socket. (#159)
  • Remove the unused fastrand and memchr dependencies. (#131)
  • Use tracing instead of log. (#140)
  • Support ESP-IDF. (#144)
  • Optimize the block_on function to reduce allocation, leading to a slight performance improvement. (#149)
Changelog

Sourced from async-io's changelog.

Version 2.0.0

  • Breaking: Async::new() now takes types that implement AsFd/AsSocket instead of AsRawFd/AsRawSocket, in order to implement I/O safety. (#142)
  • Breaking: Async::get_mut(), Async::read_with_mut() and Async::write_with_mut() are now unsafe. The underlying source is technically "borrowed" by the polling instance, so moving it out would be unsound. (#142)
  • Expose miscellaneous kqueue filters in the os::kqueue module. (#112)
  • Expose a way to get the underlying Poller's file descriptor on Unix. (#125)
  • Add a new Async::new_nonblocking method to allow users to avoid duplicating an already nonblocking socket. (#159)
  • Remove the unused fastrand and memchr dependencies. (#131)
  • Use tracing instead of log. (#140)
  • Support ESP-IDF. (#144)
  • Optimize the block_on function to reduce allocation, leading to a slight performance improvement. (#149)

Version 1.13.0

  • Add a will_fire method to Timer to test if it will ever fire (#106)

title: Add support for full Handler sequence in Handlers returned from trillium-api endpoints
body:
This adds support for init, before_send, has_upgrade, and upgrade. Default error handling is moved to the before_send and is only called when the returned handler is not found, as that indicates that FromConn extraction failed.

This introduces an Arc that can be removed during the next trillium semver-minor by making has_upgrade take a &mut Upgrade instead of &Upgrade.

closes #389 
closes #390

body:
Updates the requirements on [async-broadcast](https://github.com/smol-rs/async-broadcast) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from async-broadcast's changelog.

Version 0.6.0

  • Bump to event-listener v3.0.0.
  • Add smol-rs logo to docs.

Version 0.5.1

  • Drop parking_lot dependency, in favor of sync primitives in std.

Version 0.5.0

  • API to disable waiting for active receivers (#35).

Version 0.4.1

  • Drop unneeded easy-parallel dep.
  • Bumb dependencies to the current versions.
  • Update parking_lot to 0.12.1.
  • fix incorrect documentation for TrySendError::is_disconnected.

Version 0.4.0

  • Add RecvError::Overflowed for detecting missing messages.
  • Avoid overflows on 32- and 16-bit systems (#22).
  • Add overflow message count.
  • Clone impl of Receiver now properly duplicates it.
  • Add Receiver::new_receiver.
  • Add Receiver::new_sender and Sender::new_receiver, allowing generating senders from receivers and vice versa, respectively.
  • Switch to parking_lot::RwLock instead of std::sync::Mutex.

Version 0.3.4

  • Avoid the last clone in try_recv (#18).
  • Add some basic benchmarks.

Version 0.3.3

  • Close channel if the last receiver to drop is inactive.

Version 0.3.2

  • Fix a underflow panic (#14).
  • Document difference with other broadcast APIs.

Version 0.3.1

  • Channel API in InactiveReceiver (#11).
  • {Sender,Receiver}::inactive_receiver_count method.

title: conn-id patch: fix conn-id tests by introducing with_seed
body: The hypothesis behind this fix is that "someone else" is using fastrand between seeding the global rng and generating the first id, taking one byte from the front of the sequence. In order to make testing this crate independent of other usage of fastrand, we use a shared rng for tests. However, since this forces all requests through a single shared mutex just for ease of testing, we don't replace the global rng when ConnId is not seeded

title: Add trillium::Conn::response_body() to borrow the response body
body:
trillium_http::Conn supports returning a borrow of the response body,
but trillium:Conn doesn't have a corresponding method.

This is useful for examining a response body non-destructively without
having to take it and re-set it afterwards.

title: http patch: add `From<Cow<'static, str>>` and `From<Cow<'static, [u8]>>` for Body
Add a new trillium-acme crate to automatically manage HTTPS certificates
body:
trillium-acme helps you serve HTTPS with Trillium using automatic
certificates, via Let’s Encrypt and ACME tls-alpn-01 challenges.

I've tested this both with the staging and production Let's Encrypt
directories.

title: trillium-rustls: Make native root support optional
body:
This avoids the extra dependencies on openssl-probe and the probe for
native certificates on a server that will never have them installed.

I made native-roots a default feature for compatibility, but in a future
breaking-change version, you might consider making it non-default.

title: Fix rustdoc syntax to avoid interpretation as HTML
body:
`TlsStream<Input>` without the backquotes lets markdown interpret
`<Input>` as HTML, which looks like this:

body:
Updates the requirements on [async-compression](https://github.com/Nullus157/async-compression) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from async-compression's releases.

async-compression: v0.4.0

  • Level::Precise variant now takes a i32 instead of u32.
  • Add top level zstd module containing stable zstd crate wrapper types.
  • Add ZstdEncoder::with_quality_and_params() constructors.
  • Update zstd dependency to 0.12.
  • Remove deprecated stream, futures-bufread and futures-write crate features.
  • Remove Tokio 0.2.x and 0.3.x support (tokio-02 and tokio-03 crate features).
Changelog

Sourced from async-compression's changelog.

0.4.0 - 2023-05-10

  • Level::Precise variant now takes a i32 instead of u32.
  • Add top level zstd module containing stable zstd crate wrapper types.
  • Add ZstdEncoder::with_quality_and_params() constructors.
  • Update zstd dependency to 0.12.
  • Remove deprecated stream, futures-bufread and futures-write crate features.
  • Remove Tokio 0.2.x and 0.3.x support (tokio-02 and tokio-03 crate features).

title: Remove generics from trillium_client::Conn and trillium_client::Client and revamp transport layer for client and server
body:
The motivation behind this is to remove the generics from trillium_client::Client and trillium_client::Conn. It didn't make sense to have two completely different Transport traits when the client transport was strictly more useful.

This represents semver-minor releases of:

- [x] trillium-server-common
- [x] trillium-tokio
- [x] trillium-async-std
- [x] trillium-native-tls
- [x] trillium-rustls
- [x] trillium-smol
- [x] trillium-http
- [x] trillium-client
- [x] trillium-proxy
- [x] trillium-testing

And semver-patch releases of:

- [x] trillium
- [x] trillium-macros

title: Bump actions/checkout from 2 to 3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: github_actions
labels.description: Pull requests that update GitHub Actions code

body:
Bumps [actions/checkout](https://github.com/actions/checkout) from 2 to 3.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v3.0.0

  • Updated to the node16 runtime by default
    • This requires a minimum Actions Runner version of v2.285.0 to run, which is by default available in GHES 3.4 or later.

v2.7.0

What's Changed

  • Add new public key for known_hosts (#1237) by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#1238

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2.6.0...v2.7.0

v2.6.0

What's Changed

  • Add backports to v2 branch by @​cory-miller in actions/checkout#1040
    • Includes backports from the following changes: actions/checkout#964, actions/checkout#1002, actions/checkout#1029
    • Upgraded the licensed version to match what is used in v3.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2.5.0...v2.6.0

v2.5.0

What's Changed

  • Update @​actions/core to 1.10.0 by @​rentziass in actions/checkout#962

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2...v2.5.0

v2.4.2

What's Changed

  • Add set-safe-directory input to allow customers to take control. (#770) by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#776
  • Prepare changelog for v2.4.2. by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#778

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2...v2.4.2

v2.4.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory

v2.4.0

  • Convert SSH URLs like org-<ORG_ID>@github.com: to https://github.com/ - pr

v2.3.5

Update dependencies

v2.3.4

  • Add missing awaits
  • Swap to Environment Files

v2.3.3

  • Remove Unneeded commit information from build logs
  • Add Licensed to verify third party dependencies

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from actions/checkout's changelog.

Changelog

v3.4.0

  • Upgrade codeql actions to v2
  • Upgrade dependencies
  • Upgrade @​actions/io

v3.3.0

  • Implement branch list using callbacks from exec function
  • Add in explicit reference to private checkout options
  • [Fix comment typos (that got added in #770)](actions/checkout#1057)

v3.2.0

  • Add GitHub Action to perform release
  • Fix status badge
  • Replace datadog/squid with ubuntu/squid Docker image
  • Wrap pipeline commands for submoduleForeach in quotes
  • Update @​actions/io to 1.1.2
  • Upgrading version to 3.2.0

v3.1.0

  • Use @​actions/core saveState and getState
  • Add github-server-url input

v3.0.2

  • Add input set-safe-directory

v3.0.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory
  • Bumped various npm package versions

v3.0.0

  • Update to node 16

v2.3.1

  • Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

  • Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

  • Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

  • Changes to support GHES (here and here)

... (truncated)

  • 7b18718 Upgrade codeql actions to v2 (#1209)

  • 3ba5ee6 Add in explicit reference to private checkout options (#1050)
